name: Venlafaxine
summary: Venlafaxine is a serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) used to treat depression, anxiety, and panic disorders.
description: Venlafaxine, marketed under the brand name Effexor, is an SNRI antidepressant that works by increasing the levels of serotonin and norepinephrine in the brain, helping to improve mood and reduce anxiety symptoms. It is prescribed for major depressive disorder, generalized anxiety disorder, panic disorder, and social anxiety disorder. The extended-release formulation allows once-daily dosing for improved adherence.

contraindications: Use with MAO inhibitors or within 14 days of discontinuation

sections.text: Inhibits the reuptake of serotonin and norepinephrine, increasing their availability in the synaptic cleft, which helps regulate mood and anxiety.

adult.oral: Immediate-release: Start at 37.5–75 mg/day in divided doses; may increase by 75 mg/day at intervals of 4 days or more; maximum 375 mg/day. Extended-release: Start at 37.5–75 mg once daily; may increase by 75 mg/day at intervals of 4 days or more; maximum 225 mg/day for depression and anxiety.

pediatric.oral: Safety and efficacy not established for most indications.

items: Tablets (immediate-release): 25 mg, 37.5 mg, 50 mg, 75 mg, 100 mg
Extended-release capsules: 37.5 mg, 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg

sections.text: Initial improvement may be seen in 1–2 weeks, with full therapeutic effects typically achieved within 4–8 weeks.

other: May increase blood pressure; monitor regularly
Risk of serotonin syndrome, especially with other serotonergic drugs
May cause discontinuation symptoms if stopped abruptly; taper gradually
Monitor for worsening depression or suicidality, especially early in treatment

sections.pregnancy: Use only if potential benefit justifies potential risk; consider neonatal monitoring for withdrawal symptoms
sections.lactation: Excreted in human milk; monitor infants for adverse effects
sections.geriatrics: Monitor for hyponatremia and increased sensitivity to side effects

sections.text: Gradually reduce the dose over at least 1–2 weeks to minimize withdrawal symptoms such as dizziness, insomnia, and irritability.

items: Effective in both depression and anxiety spectrum disorders
Extended-release formulation may improve adherence and reduce side effects
Monitor closely for blood pressure changes, especially at higher doses
